news_header: The text discusses the limitations of digital applications in early childhood development, emphasizing the importance of physical interaction and traditional learning methods over screen time.
news_original_title: Katri Saarikiven kolumni: Hipelöi tietoa – muistat ja ymmärrät sen paremmin
news_text: Katri Saarikivi highlights the challenges posed by digital technology in early childhood development. She argues that physical interaction and traditional learning methods, such as using pen and paper, are crucial for cognitive development. Research indicates that excessive screen time can hinder understanding and concentration, while hands-on experiences enhance memory and learning. Although digital tools can offer benefits, the presence of an adult and physical engagement remain vital for effective learning.
